title: Vicky Pattison takes epic tumble into pool while trying to get perfect photo
text:

Former Geordie Shore star Vicky Pattison has admitted to falling into a swimming pool again and again while trying to get the perfect poolside snap.

The 31 year-old eventually managed to strike an elegant pose in a one-piece swimsuit along the edge of a pool in Bali.

She took to Instagram with the photo, but also with two more showing her taking a tumble into the water.

In one, she can be seen realising she's slipping, trying to grab onto the edge.

In the next, she beams with laughter as she pulls herself out.

The brunette beauty wrote: "Oh what we go through to get that perfect poolside snap...I fell off this ledge no less than 3 times tryna bag this beauty...but it was all worth it."

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

She also gushed about Bali, and the Bliss Sanctuary for Women retreat she's been holidaying in, as well as sharing some plans for the next coupe of weeks.

Vicky continued: "I can't believe its my last day in Bali and tomorrow I'll be leaving @blisssanctuaryforwomen ...I am absolutely gutted to be leaving such a beautiful place but I'm excited to get back to London, to my @ercan_ram and our gorgeous home...PLUS it's Halloween next week and I can't decide if I want to be a unicorn princess or a straight up slutty cat...all input appreciated!!!

"Ps check out my chins in picture 2, Pps THANK YOU @mammypatto for having the patience to take these around the pool today - you are getting better I think. Oh and ppps my swimsuit is @newlook."

Vicky's loved up with beau Ercan Ramadan, recently sharing with fans that she's feeling "truly content" with the former Towie star.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

She shared a cute photo of her and Ercan cuddling in bed, her taking a snooze on her man's chest while he snaps a selfie.

Vicky gushed: "I feel like for me, this is actually real happiness, perfect imperfection."

Fans were quick to rush to her support, though, when she said that she might never be a mum because of her hard-partying days.

Sharing a picture of herself with tear-filled eyes, she wrote: "This is a picture of me the morning I had to collect my results from the fertility clinic.

"I am usually quite a strong, together woman - but on that morning I felt like a scared little girl. Tormented by the possibility that my childish decisions over the years may have stopped me from being able to have a baby."
description: Vicky wanted the perfect poolside snap to mark the last day of her holiday but instead slipped into the water 'no less than 3 times'
